ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: During the 12 months before you became pregnant, how often did you usually have any kind of drink containing alcohol? By a drink we mean half an ounce of absolute alcohol (e.g. a 12 ounce can or glass of beer or cooler, a 5 ounce glass of wine, or a drink containing 1 shot of liquor). Choose only one.
Notes: 0 = Every day ; 1 = 5 to 6 days ; 2 = 3 to 4 days ; 3 = 2 days ; 4 = 1 day ; 5 = Not at all during the past week (skips to question 6)

ElementDescription: During the 12 months before you became pregnant, how many alcoholic drinks did you have on a typical day when you drank alcohol?
Notes: 0 = 25 or more drinks ; 1 = 19 to 24 drinks ; 2 = 16 to 18 drinks ; 3 = 12 to 15 drinks ; 4 = 9 to 11 drinks ; 5 = 7 to 8 drinks ; 6 = 5 to 6 drinks ; 7 = 3 to 4 drinks ; 8 = 2 drinks ; 9 = 1 drink

ElementDescription: During the 12 months before you became pregnant, what is the largest number of drinks containing alcohol that you drank within a 24-hour period?
Notes: 0 = 36 drinks or more ; 1 = 24 to 35 drinks ; 2 = 18 to 23 drinks ; 3 = 12 to 17 drinks ; 4 = 8 to 11 drinks ; 5 = 5 to 7 drinks ; 6 = 4 drinks ; 7 = 3 drinks ; 8 = 2 drinks ; 9 = 1 drink

ElementDescription: During the 12 months before you became pregnant, how often did you drink this largest number of drinks? Choose only one.
Notes: 0 = Every day ; 1 = 5 to 6 times a week ; 2 = 3 to 4 times a week ; 3 = twice a week ; 4 = once a week ; 5 = 2 to 3 times a month ; 6 = once a month ; 7 = 3 to 11 times in the past year ; 8 = 1 or 2 times in the past year

ElementDescription: During the 12 months before you became pregnant, how often did you have 5 or more (males) or 4 or more (females) drinks containing any kind of alcohol in within a two-hour period? [That would be the equivalent of at least 5 (4) 12-ounce cans or bottles of beer, 5 (4) five ounce glasses of wine, 5 (4) drinks each containing one shot of liquor or spirits - to be provided by interviewer if asked.] Choose only one.
Notes: 0 = Every day ; 1 = 5 to 6 days a week ; 2 = 3 to 4 days a week ; 3 = two days a week ; 4 = one day a week ; 5 = 2 to 3 days a month ; 6 = one day a month ; 7 = 3 to 11 days in the past year ; 8 = 1 or 2 days in the past year

ElementDescription: The last question will be asking about a different time period than the previous questions. During your lifetime, what is the largest number of drinks containing alcohol that you drank within a 24-hour period?
Notes: 0 = 36 drinks or more ; 1 = 24 to 35 drinks ; 2 = 18 to 23 drinks ; 3 = 12 to 17 drinks ; 4 = 8 to 11 drinks ; 5 = 5 to 7 drinks ; 6 = 4 drinks ; 7 = 3 drinks ; 8 = 2 drinks ; 9 = 1 drink

ElementDescription: Did you drink any alcohol in the past month?
How many days did you drink last month?
Notes: ex1. if you drank 3 days a week, the answer should be 3X4 = 12 days; ex2. if you drank 10 days last month, the answer should be 10 days

ElementDescription: What was your usual number of drinks in one sitting (last month)?
What was the maximum number of drinks you had in one sitting (last month)?
How many days last month did you reach this maximum (last month)?
Notes: ex1. if your answer to the last question is 5 days a week, answer should be 5X4 = 20 days.; ex2. if your answer to the last question is 13 days last month, answer should be 13 days.

ElementDescription: During your lifetime, what is the largest number of drinks containing alcohol that you drank within a 24-hour period?
Notes: 1 = 36 drinks or more ; 2 = 24 to 35 drinks ; 3 = 18 to 23 drinks ; 4 = 12 to 17 drinks ; 5 = 8 to 11 drinks ; 6 = 5 to 7 drinks ; 7 = 4 drinks ; 8 = 3 drinks ; 9 = 2 drinks ; 10 = 1 drink; 999 = No answer

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months, how often did you usually have any kind of drink containing alcohol? By a drink we mean half an ounce of absolute alcohol (e.g. a 12 ounce can or glass of beer or cooler, a 5 ounce glass of wine, or a drink containing 1 shot of liquor). Choose only one.
Notes: 1 = Every day; 2 = 5 to 6 times a week; 3 = 3 to 4 times a week; 4 = Twice a week; 5 = Once a week; 6 = 2 to 3 times a month; 7 = Once a month; 8 = 3 to 11 times in the past year; 9 = 1 or 2 times in the past year. (IF RESPONDENT GIVES ANY OF THE ABOVE RESPONSES, GO TO QUESTION 2); 10 = I did not drink any alcohol in the past year, but I did drink in the past (GO TO QUESTION 1A); 11 = I never drank any alcohol in my life (GO TO QUESTION 1B); 999 = No answer

ElementDescription: During your lifetime, what is the maximum number of drinks containing alcohol that you drank within a 24-hour period? (asked here only of those who did not drink any alcohol during the past 12 months)
Notes: 1 = 36 drinks or more; 2 = 24 to 35 drinks; 3 = 18 to 23 drinks; 4 = 12 to 17 drinks; 5 = 8 to 11 drinks; 6 = 5 to 7 drinks; 7 = 4 drinks; 8 = 3 drinks; 9 = 2 drinks; 10 = 1 drink

ElementDescription: So you have never had a drink containing alcohol in your entire life? (asked only of those who say they never drank alcohol in their lives)
Notes: 1 = Yes, I never drank (DONE WITH ALCOHOL QUESTIONS); 2 = No, I did drink (GO BACK TO QUESTION 1 AND REPEAT)

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months, how many alcoholic drinks did you have on a typical day when you drank alcohol?
Notes: 1 = 25 or more drinks; 2 = 19 to 24 drinks; 3 = 16 to 18 drinks; 4 = 12 to 15 drinks; 5 = 9 to 11 drinks; 6 = 7 to 8 drinks; 7 = 5 to 6 drinks; 8 = 3 to 4 drinks; 9 = 2 drinks; 10 = 1 drink; 999 = No answer

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months, what is the largest number of drinks containing alcohol that you drank within a 24-hour period?
Notes: 1 = 36 drinks or more ; 2 = 24 to 35 drinks ; 3 = 18 to 23 drinks ; 4 = 12 to 17 drinks ; 5 = 8 to 11 drinks ; 6 = 5 to 7 drinks ; 7 = 4 drinks ; 8 = 3 drinks ; 9 = 2 drinks ; 10 = 1 drink; 999 = No answer

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months, how often did you drink this largest number of drinks? Choose only one.
Notes: 1 = Every day; 2 = 5 to 6 times a week; 3 = 3 to 4 times a week; 4 = Twice a week; 5 = Once a week; 6 = 2 to 3 times a month; 7 = Once a month; 8 = 3 to 11 times in the past year; 9 = 1 or 2 times in the past year; 999 = No answer

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months, how often did you have 5 or more (males) or 4 or more (females) drinks containing any kind of alcohol in within a two-hour period? (That would be the equivalent of at least 5 (4) 12-ounce cans or bottles of beer, 5 (4) five ounce glasses of wine, 5 (4) drinks each containing one shot of liquor or spirits - to be provided by interviewer if asked.) Choose only one.
Notes: 1 = Every day; 2 = 5 to 6 days a week; 3 = 3 to 4 days a week; 4 = Two days a week; 5 = One day a week; 6 = 2 to 3 days a month; 7 = One day a month; 8 = 3 to 11 days in the past year; 9 = 1 or 2 days in the past year; 10 = Never in the past year; 11 = Never in my lifetime

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months, how often did you have 3 or more drinks containing any kind of alcohol in within a two-hour period? Choose only one:
Notes: 1 = Every day; 2 = 5 to 6 days a week; 3 = 3 to 4 days a week; 4 = Two days a week; 5 = One day a week; 6 = 2 to 3 days a month; 7 = One day a month; 8 = 3 to 11 days in the past year; 9 = 1 or 2 days in the past year; 10  = Never

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months, how often did you have 4 or more drinks containing any kind of alcohol in within a two-hour period? Choose only one:
Notes: 1 = Every day; 2 = 5 to 6 days a week; 3 = 3 to 4 days a week; 4 = Two days a week; 5 = One day a week; 6 = 2 to 3 days a month; 7 = One day a month; 8 = 3 to 11 days in the past year; 9 = 1 or 2 days in the past year; 10  = Never

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months, how often did you have 5 or more drinks containing any kind of alcohol in within a two-hour period? Choose only one:
Notes: 1 = Every day; 2 = 5 to 6 days a week; 3 = 3 to 4 days a week; 4 = Two days a week; 5 = One day a week; 6 = 2 to 3 days a month; 7 = One day a month; 8 = 3 to 11 days in the past year; 9 = 1 or 2 days in the past year; 10 = Never; 999 = No answer

ElementDescription: When you think about problems related to your alcohol use, to what extent do you view this as our problem [shared by you and your partner equally] or mainly your own problem?
Notes: 1= It is my problem to manage; 2= It is my problem to manage but something that affects both of us; 3= It is our problem to manage as a team

ElementDescription: When you think about problems related to your partners alcohol use, to what extent do you view this as our problem [shared by you and your partner equally] or mainly your partners own problem?
Notes: 1= It is my problem to manage; 2= It is my problem to manage but something that affects both of us; 3= It is our problem to manage as a team

ElementDescription: On average, how many standard-sized drinks containing alcohol do you have in a week?
Notes: 1 = 36 drinks or more ; 2 = 24 to 35 drinks ; 3 = 18 to 23 drinks ; 4 = 12 to 17 drinks ; 5 = 8 to 11 drinks ; 6 = 5 to 7 drinks ; 7 = 4 drinks ; 8 = 3 drinks ; 9 = 2 drinks ; 10 = 1 drink ; 11 = None

ElementDescription: When you drink, what is the maximum number of standard-sized drinks you have at one time?
Notes: 1 = 36 drinks or more ; 2 = 24 to 35 drinks ; 3 = 18 to 23 drinks ; 4 = 12 to 17 drinks ; 5 = 8 to 11 drinks ; 6 = 5 to 7 drinks ; 7 = 4 drinks ; 8 = 3 drinks ; 9 = 2 drinks ; 10 = 1 drink

ElementDescription: In the past month, how often did you usually have any kind of drink containing alcohol?
Notes: 0 = Less than once a week or not at all; 1 = Once a week or more

ElementDescription: During the 12 months before you became pregnant, how often did you have 4 or more drinks containing any kind of alcohol in within a two-hour period?
Notes: 1 = Every day; 2 = 5 to 6 times a week; 3 = 3 to 4 times a week; 4 = 2 days a week; 5 = 1 day a week; 6 = 2 to 3 days a month; 7 = 1 day a month; 8 = 3 to 11 days in the year before I became pregnant; 9 = 1 or 2 days in the  year before I became pregnant; 10 = Never

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months, how many alcoholic drinks did you have on a typical week when you drank alcohol?
Notes: 1=25 or more drinks; 2=19 to 24 drinks; 3=16 to 18 drinks; 4=14 to 15 drinks; 5=12 to 13 drinks; 6=9 to 11 drinks; 7=7 to 8 drinks; 8=5 to 6 drinks; 9=3 to 4 drinks; 10=2 drinks; 11=1 drink

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months, how often did you have 10 or more (assigned male at birth) or 8 or more (assigned female at birth) drinks containing any kind of alcohol in within a two-hour period?
Notes: 1=Every day; 2=5 to 6 days a week; 3=3 to 4 days a week; 4=2 days a week; 5=1 day a week; 6=2 to 3 days a month; 7=1 day a month; 8=3 to 11 days in the past year; 9=1 or 2 days in the past year; 10=Never in the past year; 11=Never in my lifetime

ElementDescription: Largest number of drinks in a single day in the past 30 days
Notes: 0 = I haven''t had a drink in the past 30 days; 1 = 1-2 drinks; 2 = 3-4 drinks; 3 = 5-7 drinks; 4 = 8-11 drinks; 5 = 12-23 drinks; 6 = 24 or more drinks; 9998 = Do not to answer. Asked to those who drank 1 day or more or do not want to answer

ElementDescription: During the past 3 months, how many times did you have 4 or more drinks in a single drinking occasion (within about a two-hour timeframe)? Please answer using a whole number.
During the past 3 months, how many times did you get drunk (not just a little high or light-headed) from alcohol?
Here are some things kids your age have said about drinking alcohol. How strongly do you agree or disagree with each statement? Makes you do things you might regret
Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Here are some things kids your age have said about drinking alcohol. How strongly do you agree or disagree with each statement? Lets you have more fun
Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Here are some things kids your age have said about drinking alcohol. How strongly do you agree or disagree with each statement? Gets you into trouble
Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Here are some things kids your age have said about drinking alcohol. How strongly do you agree or disagree with each statement? Helps you get away from your problems
Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Here are some things kids your age have said about drinking alcohol. How strongly do you agree or disagree with each statement? Slows down your reaction time
Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Here are some things kids your age have said about drinking alcohol. How strongly do you agree or disagree with each statement? Makes sex more enjoyable
Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have the following things happened to you because of drinking alcohol (beer, wine, or hard liquor)?: You felt really sick because of drinking alcohol
Notes: 1=Never; 2=1 time; 3=2 times; 4=3-5 times; 5=6-9 times; 6=10-19 times; 7=20 times

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have the following things happened to you because of drinking alcohol (beer, wine, or hard liquor)?: You got into trouble (at school or home) because of drinking alcohol
Notes: 1=Never; 2=1 time; 3=2 times; 4=3-5 times; 5=6-9 times; 6=10-19 times; 7=20 times

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have the following things happened to you because of drinking alcohol (beer, wine, or hard liquor)?: You did something you later felt sorry for because of drinking alcohol
Notes: 1=Never; 2=1 time; 3=2 times; 4=3-5 times; 5=6-9 times; 6=10-19 times; 7=20 times

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have the following things happened to you because of drinking alcohol (beer, wine, or hard liquor)?: You got into a fight or argument because of drinking alcohol
Notes: 1=Never; 2=1 time; 3=2 times; 4=3-5 times; 5=6-9 times; 6=10-19 times; 7=20 times

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have the following things happened to you because of drinking alcohol (beer, wine, or hard liquor)?: You missed school (work or other obligations) because of drinking alcohol
Notes: 1=Never; 2=1 time; 3=2 times; 4=3-5 times; 5=6-9 times; 6=10-19 times; 7=20 times

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have the following things happened to you because of drinking alcohol (beer, wine, or hard liquor)?: You have not been able to remember large stretches of time while drinking heavily
Notes: 1=Never; 2=1 time; 3=2 times; 4=3-5 times; 5=6-9 times; 6=10-19 times; 7=20 times

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have the following things happened to you because of drinking alcohol (beer, wine, or hard liquor)?: You found it difficult to limit how much you drink
Notes: 1=Never; 2=1 time; 3=2 times; 4=3-5 times; 5=6-9 times; 6=10-19 times; 7=20 times

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have the following things happened to you because of drinking alcohol (beer, wine, or hard liquor)?: You passed out from drinking
Notes: 1=Never; 2=1 time; 3=2 times; 4=3-5 times; 5=6-9 times; 6=10-19 times; 7=20 times

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have the following things happened to you because of drinking alcohol (beer, wine, or hard liquor)?: Your drinking has gotten you into sexual situations you later regretted
Notes: 1=Never; 2=1 time; 3=2 times; 4=3-5 times; 5=6-9 times; 6=10-19 times; 7=20 times

ElementDescription: Which of these best describes you?
Notes: 1=I have quit using alcohol and will never go back; 2=I have cut down on or quit my alcohol use, but I still worry about slipping back so I need to keep working on the changes I have made; 3=I still use alcohol, but I will begin to change like cutting back on the amount of alcohol that I use; 4=I definitely plan to change my alcohol use and I am ready to make some plans about how to change; 5=I definitely plan to change my alcohol use but I am not ready to make plans about how to change; 6=I often think about changing the way that I use alcohol, but I have not planned to change it yet; 7=I sometimes think about changing the way that I use alcohol, but I have not planned to change it yet; 8=I rarely think about changing the way that I use alcohol, and I have no plans to change; 9=I never think about changing the way I use alcohol and I have no plans to change; 10=I enjoy using alcohol and have decided never to change it. I have no interest in changing the way that I use alcohol

ElementDescription: Your best friend is drinking alcohol
Notes: 1= I would definitely drink; 2= I would probably drink; 3= I would probably NOT drink; 4= I would definitely NOT drink

ElementDescription: Alcohol: You are bored at a party
Notes: 1= I would definitely drink; 2= I would probably drink; 3= I would probably NOT drink; 4= I would definitely NOT drink

ElementDescription: All your friends at a party are drinking alcohol
Notes: 1= I would definitely drink; 2= I would probably drink; 3= I would probably NOT drink; 4= I would definitely NOT drink

ElementDescription: On the days you drink alcohol, about how many drinks do you have? (By one drink, we mean a can of beer, a 5 oz. glass of wine, or a 1.5 oz shot of hard liquor)
Notes: 1=Does not apply, I do not drink alcohol at all; 2=A few sips; 3=About 1/2 a drink; 4=1 drink; 5=2 drinks; 6=3 drinks; 7=4 drinks; 8=5 drinks; 9=6 drinks; 10=7 drinks; 11=8 drinks; 12= 9 drinks; 13= 10 drinks; 14=11 drinks; 15=12 drinks; 16=13 drinks; 17=14 drinks; 18=15 drinks or more

ElementDescription: What is the largest number of drinks you had on any day in the past month (30 days)?
Notes: 1=Does not apply, I do not drink alcohol at all; 2=A few sips; 3=About 1/2 a drink; 4=1 drink; 5=2 drinks; 6=3 drinks; 7=4 drinks; 8=5 drinks; 9=6 drinks; 10=7 drinks; 11=8 drinks; 12= 9 drinks; 13= 10 drinks; 14=11 drinks; 15=12 drinks; 16=13 drinks; 17=14 drinks; 18=15 drinks or more

Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree

Notes: 0=Did not drink in the past 30 days; 1=1-2 occasions; 2=3-5 occasions; 3=6 or more occasions

Notes: 0=Did not drink in the past 30 days; 1=1-2 drinks; 2=3-5 drinks; 3=6 or more drinks; 4=7 or more drinks

On how many occasions did you drink to get drunk in the past 30 days?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=1-2 occasions; 2=3-5 occasions; 3=6 or more occasions

ElementDescription: How old were you the first time you had your first taste or sip of alcohol?
How old were you when you had a full drink?
How old were you when you first got drunk?

ElementDescription: (Your first sip of an alcoholic beverage) Whose drink was it/who did the drink belong to?
Notes: 1=My own drink; 2=Friend; 3=Peer/classmate/co-worker; 4=Other young person who is not a friend (age 20 or younger); 5=My mom; 6=My dad; 7=An uncle or aunt; 8=Brother or sister who was age 21 or older; 9=Brother or sister who was age 20 or younger; 10=Other adult family member; 11=Another adult (e.g., someone else's parent) 12=I didn't know the person/it was a stranger; 13=I don't know who the drink belonged to

ElementDescription: (Your first sip of an alcoholic beverage) Did the person the drink belonged to offer you a sip or did you take it when they weren't looking?
Notes: 1=They offered me a sip; 2=I intentionally took it when they weren't looking; 3=I accidentally took it when they weren't looking

ElementDescription: (Your first sip of an alcoholic beverage) Do you remember when this happened, or did you find out later (for example: your parents or somebody else told you about it)?
Notes: 1=I remember it; 2=I don't remember it - someone else told me about it

ElementDescription: Did you ever get drunk; that is, when your speech was slurred or you were unsteady on your feet?

During the last 12 months, how often did you usually have any kind of drink containing alcohol?
Notes: 1=1 to 3 times in the past year; 2=4 to 11 times in the past year; 3=About once a month; 4=2 to 3 times a month; 5=Once a week; 6=Twice a week; 7=3 to 4 times a week; 8=5 to 6 times a week (nearly every day); 9=Every day

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months, how many alcoholic drinks did you have on a typical day when you drank alcohol?
Notes: 0=Less than one drink; 1=1 total drink; 2=2 total drinks; 3=3 total drinks; 4=4 total drinks; 5=5 total drinks; 6=6 total drinks; 7=7 or 8 total drinks; 8=9 or 10 total drinks; 9=11 or 12 total drinks; 10=More than 12 drinks

ElementDescription: In the past 3 months, when you were drinking alcohol, how many drinks did you usually have on any one occasion?
Notes: 1= Less than one drink; 2= 1 total drink; 3= 2 total drinks; 4= 3 total drinks; 5= 4 total drinks; 6= 5 total drinks; 7= 6 total drinks; 8= 7 or 8 drinks; 9= 9 or 10 drinks; 10= 11 or 12 drinks; 11= More than 12 drinks

Notes: 1= 1 or 2 times in the past 3 months; 2= 3-5 times in the past 3 months; 3= About once a month; 4= 2 to 3 times a month; 5= Once or twice a week; 6= 3 to 4 times a week; 7= 5 to 6 times a week (nearly every day); 8= Every day; 9= 0 times in the past 3 months

ElementDescription: In the past 3 months, how often did you have 5 or more drinks containing any kind of alcohol in them within a two-hour period?
Notes: 1= 1 or 2 times in the past 3 months; 2= 3-5 times in the past 3 months; 3= About once a month; 4= 2 to 3 times a month; 5= Once or twice a week; 6= 3 to 4 times a week; 7= 5 to 6 times a week (nearly every day); 8= Every day; 9= 0 times in the past 3 months

ElementDescription: In your lifetime, what is the maximum number of drinks you have had on one occasion?
How likely is it that you will try to cut down or stop using alcohol in the next year? (please check one only)
Notes: 1= Definitely will not try; 2= Probably will not try; 3= Not sure; 4= Probably will try; 5= Definitely will try

Here is a list of reasons people sometimes give for drinking alcohol. Would you say that you drank for any of the following reasons the first time you had a FULL drink? To forget your worries

Here is a list of reasons people sometimes give for drinking alcohol. Would you say that you drank for any of the following reasons the first time you had a FULL drink? Because it helped you enjoy a party

Here is a list of reasons people sometimes give for drinking alcohol. Would you say that you drank for any of the following reasons the first time you had a FULL drink? Because it helped you when you felt depressed or nervous
Here is a list of reasons people sometimes give for drinking alcohol. Would you say that you drank for any of the following reasons the first time you had a FULL drink? Because you liked the feeling

Here is a list of reasons people sometimes give for drinking alcohol. Would you say that you drank for any of the following reasons the first time you had a FULL drink? So that others would not tease you about not drinking

Notes: 0= Definitely Not Willing; 1= Probably Not Willing; 2= Probably Willing; 3= Definitely Willing

ElementDescription: Here is a list of reasons people sometimes give for drinking alcohol. Would you say that you drank for any of the following reasons the first time you had a FULL drink? Because it made a social gathering more fun

Here is a list of reasons people sometimes give for drinking alcohol. Would you say that you drank for any of the following reasons the first time you had a FULL drink? Because it gave you a pleasant feeling

Here is a list of reasons people sometimes give for drinking alcohol. Would you say that you drank for any of the following reasons the first time you had a FULL drink? To forget about your problems
Here is a list of reasons people sometimes give for drinking alcohol. Would you say that you drank for any of the following reasons the first time you had a FULL drink? To be liked
Here is a list of reasons people sometimes give for drinking alcohol. Would you say that you drank for any of the following reasons the first time you had a FULL drink? So you would not feel left out
